proof:
Proof. By Lemmas 33, and 34, whp all vertex sets in G with size at least $\ge \eta n$ have average degree is at least $3d/4$. Also by the second part of the first Lemma, whp, for any vertex set $S \subseteq V_G$ with size between $\eta n$ and $(1-\eta)n$, $|E_G(S, \bar{S})| \ge \frac{5d}{6}|S|(n-|S|)$. Also whp $n_C \ge (1-e^{-d/3})n$. Assume further on G satisfies these properties.
Also by the choice of $\eta$ and by Lemma 12, whp G is such that for any $F \in \Omega_C^{\text{ord}}$, there is a giant component in $(V_C, F)$ with total degree $\ge \frac{9}{10} \text{deg}_G(V_C)$. Thus the set $S$ of vertices in the non-giant components has total degree $\le \frac{1}{10} \text{deg}_G(V_C)$. Note that all edges in $E_G(S, \bar{S})$ are in $E_C \setminus F$. We consider three cases, based on the size of $S$.
If $|S| \ge \frac{n}{2}$, then $\text{deg}_G(S) > \frac{dn}{4}$. But also $\text{deg}_G(S) \le \frac{\text{deg}_G(V_C)}{10} \le \frac{dn}{10} + o(n)$, which is a contradiction.
Next consider the case $\eta n \le |S| \le \frac{n}{2}$. Then $|E_C \setminus F| \ge |E_G(S, \bar{S})| \ge \frac{5\eta n d}{12}$. But we know that $|E_C \setminus F| \le \eta |E_C|$. Since $|E_C|$ is the number of edges in the giant component, it must be less than the total number of vertices, so $|E_C| < n_C < n$. This implies $|E_C \setminus F| < \eta n$. Thus we have $\frac{5\eta n d}{12} \le |E_C \setminus F| < \eta n$. This simplifies to $5d/12 < 1$, or $d < 12/5$. This is a contradiction for large enough $d$.
Thus the only remaining possibility is $|S| \le \eta n$. Then $c(F) \le |S| \le \eta n + 1$ and $|F| \le |E_C| \le nd/2 + \eta n$ (the last inequality holds whp). Thus we obtain that $w_C(F) \le q^{\eta n+1}(e^\beta - 1)^{nd/2+\eta n} < q^{\eta n+1}q^{(2-1/10)\frac{nd}{d}+\eta n} = q^{n[1-1/20+2\eta]}$.
Since $\emptyset$ is a configuration with a weight $q^{n_C} \ge q^{n(1-e^{-d/3})}$, it follows that $Z_C \ge q^{n-ne^{-d/3}}$. There are at most $2^{|E_C|} = 2^{nd/2+\eta n}$ ordered configurations, therefore,
$$ \frac{Z_C^{\text{dis}}}{Z_C} \le 2^{nd/2+\eta n}q^{n[-1+1-1/10+2\eta+e^{-d/3}]} = \exp\{n[d\ln 2/2 + \log q(-1/10 + 2\eta + e^{-d/3})]\} . $$
Since $1/10 - 2\eta - e^{-d/3} > 1/20$ for all d large enough, this becomes $\exp\{nd \ln 2/2 - n \log q/20\}$, which is $\le e^{-n}$ for all q large enough.
